class scholarly.scholarly.ScholarlyDefault(use_proxy: bool)[source]¶

Bases: scholarly.scholarly.Scholarly

class scholarly.scholarly.ScholarlySelenium(use_proxy: bool, browser='chrome')[source]¶

Bases: scholarly.scholarly.Scholarly

scholarly.scholarly.get_scholarly_instance(use_proxy: bool = False, use_selenium: bool = True, browser: str = 'chrome') → scholarly.scholarly.ScholarlySelenium[source]¶

Returns an instance of the scraper

To use selenium a webdriver is required

Keyword Arguments

  • {bool} -- Whether or not to use a proxy during scraping (default (use_proxy) – {False})

  • {bool} -- Whether or not to use Selenium during scraphig (default (use_selenium) – {True})

  • {str} -- What webdriver to use when scraping with selenium. Either 'chrome' or 'firefox' (default (browser) – {‘chrome’})
